intro: Trichoscypha laurentii, commonly known as the African snowball tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its large, palmate leaves and showy, white flower clusters. The tree produces small, fleshy fruits that are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
